Page1.name: Dodge Charger R/T
Page1.description: Part of the long running Charger series the 1970 Dodge Charger R/T gained particular fame for being driven by Vin Diesel's Dominic Toretto in the 2001 film The Fast and The Furious. The first Dodge Charger was introdcued in 1966 the line continues to this day.

Page1.name: Aston Martin DB5
Page1.description: The Aston Martian DB5 was made famous after being driven by James Bond in the 1964 film Goldfinger. The car has appeared in seven Bond films most recently in by Daniel Craig's Bond in Spectre(2015) The car was first introduced in 1963.

Page1.name: DMC Delorian
Page1.description: The DMC Delorean was originally produced between 1981-1983 but didn't sell very well. The car became popular after being made into a time machine by Doc Brown in the 1985 classic film Back To The Future. Due to the films popularity there are still Deloreans on the road today.

Page1.name: Mini Cooper
Page1.description: The Mini Cooper is a famous British car made in the late 1900s. The car was made famous when it was used to steal gold in the 1969 film The Italian Job and its 2003 remake. The Mini line was first launched in 1959.

Page1.name: Ford Model T
Page1.description: Famous for being the first affordable car the Ford Model T made car travel a reality for middle class Americans in the early 20th century. The car was first introduced on October 1st 1908 and stayed in production until 1927.

Page2.name: GM X Stiletto
Page2.description: Designed to look like a rocket, the GM X Stiletto was displayed at the 1964 New York World's Fair. The way to enter the car involved folding up the roof and rear section and climbing in.

Page2.name: Lincoln Futura
Page2.description: Built in 1954, the Lincoln Futura is more commonly known as the 1966 Batmobile. This came about after the car was sold to George Barris bought the car after it's movie role in 'It Started with a Kiss' and then was left out to weather. One paint job later and it became suitable for even Batman.

Page2.name: Mazda Furai
Page2.description: The Mazda Furai was shown off in 2008 and took inspiration from the Japanese style of Nagare which means flow in Japanese. While this may invoke the idea of flowing water, unfortuately this cars fate couldn't be farther from that. This concept car was destoryed in a fire when in the hands of Top Gear.

Page2.name: Dodge Deora
Page2.description: The Dodge Deora is a unique specimen in the concept car world. Orinigally invisioned by the Alexander Brothers, this car was embraced by Chrysler and they help make it a reality. Finished in 1967, this car was then leased by Chrysler to show off to the world.

Page2.name: Jeep Mighty FC
Page2.description: The Jeep Mighty FC looks like a Wrangler but long. This vehicle was designed to be the perfect companion when going off roading, able to climb over rocks and making even the roughestest terrrain drive as smooth as a freshly paved road.
